snippet: While Congress is in recess, advocates are pressing Republicans in their home districts to act on immigration reform.
abstract: Editorial praises the array of determined immigration reform advocates from across the country who have plunged into a month of protests, rallies, vigils, townhall meetings, phone-calling and canvassing, focusing on Republican congressmen in their home districts; expresses some hope that advocacy and relentless optimism can revive possibility of bipartisan immigration reform bill being passed in the House.
lead_paragraph: While Congress is in recess, advocates are pressing Republicans in their home districts to act on immigration reform.
